verses.plain: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

tokens.t: I will sing of the mercies of the
for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

verses.plain: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.

tokens.t: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.

verses.plain: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,

tokens.t: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,

verses.plain: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

tokens.t: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

verses.plain: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

tokens.t: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O
: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

verses.plain: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?

tokens.t: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the
among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the

verses.plain: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.

tokens.t: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all
about him.

verses.plain: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

tokens.t: O
God of hosts, who
a strong
like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

verses.plain: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.

tokens.t: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.

verses.plain: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.

tokens.t: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.

verses.plain: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.

tokens.t: The heavens
thine, the earth also
thine:
the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.

verses.plain: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.

tokens.t: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.

verses.plain: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

tokens.t: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand,
high is thy right hand.

verses.plain: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

tokens.t: Justice and judgment
the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

verses.plain: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.

tokens.t: Blessed
the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O
, in the light of thy countenance.

verses.plain: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

tokens.t: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

verses.plain: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

tokens.t: For thou
the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

verses.plain: For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

tokens.t: For the
our defence; and the Holy One of Israel
our king.

verses.plain: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

tokens.t: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon
mighty; I have exalted
chosen out of the people.

verses.plain: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

tokens.t: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

verses.plain: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.

tokens.t: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.

verses.plain: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

tokens.t: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

verses.plain: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.

tokens.t: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.

verses.plain: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

tokens.t: But my faithfulness and my mercy
with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

verses.plain: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

tokens.t: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

verses.plain: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

tokens.t: He shall cry unto me, Thou
my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

verses.plain: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

tokens.t: Also I will make him
firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

verses.plain: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

tokens.t: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

verses.plain: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

tokens.t: His seed also will I make
for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

verses.plain: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

tokens.t: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

verses.plain: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

tokens.t: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

verses.plain: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

tokens.t: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

verses.plain: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

tokens.t: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

verses.plain: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

tokens.t: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

verses.plain: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

tokens.t: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

verses.plain: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

tokens.t: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

verses.plain: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

tokens.t: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and
a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

verses.plain: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.

tokens.t: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.

verses.plain: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

tokens.t: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown
to the ground.

verses.plain: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

tokens.t: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

verses.plain: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.

tokens.t: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.

verses.plain: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

tokens.t: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

verses.plain: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

tokens.t: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

verses.plain: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

tokens.t: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

verses.plain: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

tokens.t: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

verses.plain: How long, LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

tokens.t: How long,
? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

verses.plain: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?

tokens.t: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?

verses.plain: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

tokens.t: What man
liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

verses.plain: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

tokens.t: Lord, where
thy former lovingkindnesses,
thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

verses.plain: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;

tokens.t: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants;
I do bear in my bosom
all the mighty people;

verses.plain: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

tokens.t: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O
; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

verses.plain: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

tokens.t: Blessed
the
for evermore. Amen, and Amen.

footnotes.text: Maschil…: or, A Psalm for Ethan the Ezrahite, to give instruction
to all…: Heb. to generation and generation
thy…: Heb. the arm of thy strength
the fulness…: or, all it containeth
a…: Heb. an arm with might
the LORD…: or, our shield is of the LORD, and our king is of the Holy One of Israel
will…: Heb. I will not make void from him
